name: bigorf_extract
title: bigorf_extract
description: <text lang="en">extract sequences with the largest ORF from a sequence translated with EMBOSS transseq and checktrans</text> </description>

references.value: EMBOSS: The European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite (2000) Rice,P. Longden,I. and Bleasby, A. Trends in Genetics 16, (6) pp276--277</reference>
EMBOSS: The European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite (2000) Rice,P. Longden,I. and Bleasby, A. Trends in Genetics 16, (6) pp276--277</reference>
EMBOSS: The European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite (2000) Rice,P. Longden,I. and Bleasby, A. Trends in Genetics 16, (6) pp276--277</reference>
EMBOSS: The European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite (2000) Rice,P. Longden,I. and Bleasby, A. Trends in Genetics 16, (6) pp276--277</reference>
Larget, B. and D. Simon (1999). Markov chain Monte Carlo algorithms for the Bayesian analysis of phylogenetic trees. Molecular Biology and Evolution 16:750-759.</reference>
Simon, D. and B. Larget. 1998. Bayesian analysis in molecular biology and evolution (BAMBE), version 1.01 beta. Department of Mathematics and Computer Science, Duquesne University.</reference>
EMBOSS: The European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite (2000) Rice,P. Longden,I. and Bleasby, A. Trends in Genetics 16, (6) pp276--277</reference>

protein_sequences.comment: <text lang="en">This is where you should enter the list of candidate ORFs for each gene</text> </comment>

characters_to_strip.comment: <text lang="en">Number of characters that should be stripped. Default value is 4 because transseq adds 2 characters (_[frame index]) and checktrans another 2 (_[candidate index])</text> </comment>

comment: <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}div >This tool reorders the entries of an MSA according to a reference set of sequences.</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}div> </comment>
